question: Ic (beon) #### hal — I will be safe
explanation: Here 'beon' is in the first person singular form 'beo' as the subject is 'ic'

question: Ðu ana (beon) #### eallra dema — You alone are the judge of all
explanation: Here 'beon' is in the second person singular form 'bist' as the subject is 'ðu'

question: Min sweord (beon) #### min lif — My sword is my life
explanation: Here 'beon' is in the third person singular form 'biþ' as the subject is 'min sweord'

question: Swa monige (beon) #### men ofer eorþan swa beoþ modgeþoncas — There are as many viewpoints as there are men on earth
explanation: Here 'beon' is plural form 'beoþ' as the subject is 'men

question: Ic ondræde me for ðam ðe ic (wesan) #### nacod — I am afraid because I am naked
explanation: Here 'wesan' is in the first person singular form 'eom' as the subject is 'ic'

question: Sarnys ðe hrepode ond ðu (wesan) #### geunrotsod — Pain touched you and you are made unhappy
explanation: Here 'wesan' is in the second person singular form 'eart' as the subject is 'ðu'

question: Þearle (wesan) #### me nu min heorte onhæted ond hige geomor swyðe mid sorgum gedrefed — Now my heart is in me sorely inflamed and my mind troubled, deeply afflicted with sorrows
explanation: Here 'wesan' is in the third person singular form 'is' as the subject is 'min heorte'

question: (wesan) #### þissa heldora wegas forworhte swa ic mid wihte ne mæg of þissum lioðobendum — These gates of hell are obstructed so I may not escape these limb—bonds
explanation: Here 'wesan' is in the pluralform 'sind' as the subject is 'þissa heldora wegas'

question: Hiericho seo burh (wesan) #### mid weallum ymbtrymed ond fæste belocen — Jericho, the city, was surrounded with walls and firmly locked
explanation: Here 'wesan' is in the past third person singular form 'wæs' as the subject is 'seo burh'

question: Forðan ðe ðu (wesan) #### gehyrsum ðines wifes wordum, and min bebod forsawe, þu scealt mid earfoðnyssum þe metes tilian — Because you were obedient to the words of your wife, and despised my commandment, you shall get your food with hardships
explanation: Here 'wesan' is in the past second person singular form 'wære' as the subject is 'ðu'

question: Drihten (wesan) #### sprecende on sumere tide to his apostolum mid bigspellum — The Lord was speaking at a certain time to his apostles in parables
explanation: Here 'wesan' is in the past third person singular form 'wæs' as the subject is 'Drihten'

question: Hie (wesan) #### gesamnode binnan ðære byrig Hierusalem, six hund ðusend manna — They were assembled within the city of Jerusalem, six hundred thousand men
explanation: Here 'wesan' is in the past plural form 'wæron' as the subject is 'hie'

question: Ðær ic (beon) #### fægere beþeaht fiðerum ðinum — There I will be pleasantly enveloped in your wings
explanation: Here 'beon' is in the first person singular form 'beo' as the subjet is 'ic'

question: For ðan ðe ðu ðis dydest ðu (beon) #### awyrged betweox eallum nytenum and wildeorum — Because you did this, you will be cursed among all the beasts and wild animals
explanation: Here 'beon' is in the second person singular form 'beo' as the subject is 'ðu'

question: Hat (beon) #### monegum egeslic æled — The dreadful fire will be hot to many
explanation: Here 'beon' is in the third person singular form 'biþ' as the subject is 'æled'

question: Swa biþ sæ smilte þonne hie wind ne weceþ swa (beon) #### þeoda geþwære, þonne hie geþingad habbað — As the sea is calm when the wind doesn't blow, so are people at peace when they have negotiated
explanation: Here 'beon' is in the plural form 'beoþ' as the subject is 'þeoda'

question: Ic (wesan) #### mare þonne þes middangeard læsse þonne hondwyrm leohtre þonne mona swiftre þonne sunne — I am more than this middle world, less than a mite, lighter than the moon, swifter than the sun
explanation: Here 'wesan' is in the first person singular form 'eom' as the subject is 'ic'

question: Nu (wesan) #### þu dumb ond deaf — Now you are dumb and deaf
explanation: Here 'wesan' is in the second person singular form 'eart' as the subject is 'þu'

question: Her (wesan) #### seo bot hu þu meaht þine æ ceras betan gif hie nellaþ wel weaxan — Here is the remedy how you can restore your fields if they will not grow well
explanation: Here 'wesan' is in the third person singular form 'is' as the subject is 'seo bot'

question: Hie cwædon Drihten her (wesan) #### twa swurd — They said, 'Lord, here are two swords'
explanation: Here 'wesan' is in the plural form 'sind' as the subject is 'twa swurd'

question: Se Cristendom (wesan) #### swilc on his dæge þæt ælc man hwæt his hade to belumpe folgade se þe wolde — Christianity in his day was such that every man who wanted to would follow what pertained to his order
explanation: Here 'wesan' is in the past third person singular form 'wæs' as the subject is 'se Cristendom'

question: Paulus cwæð to Petre: Broðer þu (wesan) #### Gode gecoren ær ic — Paul said to Peter, 'Brother, you were God's chosen before me'
explanation: Here 'wesan' is in the past second person singular form 'wære' as the subject is 'þu'

question: Freond he (wesan) #### ðurh geleafan ond wiþercora þurh weorc — A friend he was through faith, and a reprobate in works
explanation: Here 'wesan' is in the past third person singular form 'wæs' as the subject is 'he'

question: Hie (wesan) #### swa eaþmode ond swa unscæððige swa þæt cild wæs — They were as humble and as innocent as the child
explanation: Here 'wesan' is in the past plural form 'wæron' as the subject is 'hie'
